title: SCP-8107
content:
[[>]]
[[module Rate]]
[[/>]]


**Item #:** SCP-8107

**Object Class:** --Safe-- Euclid

**Special Containment Procedures:** Keep SCP-8107 in the storage locker of Low-Hazard Testing Lab 6 at Site-19. Dr Kingston is to maintain possession of the key to the locker. 

Researchers must submit a written proposal for approval to Dr Kingston if they wish to test an unused bag. A verbal request is sufficient for testing with a pre-used bag, though destruction of any bag may result in loss of testing privileges.

As all the bags detached from the stack and used for testing (SCP-8107-2) are presumed to have the same anomalous effects as the unused bags (SCP-8107-1), further separation of unused bags is prohibited unless and until all used bags have been destroyed in the course of legitimate tests.

Investigation is to continue of Dollar General franchises across the country for any corresponding anomalous events, items, or persons. 

**Description:** SCP-8107 consists of a total of 198 ‘T-Shirt’ style plastic shopping bags inside a cardboard box, 92 unused and still attached together in the standard fashion (SCP 8107-1) and 6 of them used in testing (SCP 8107-2). The markings on the cardboard box are typical for the boxes that shopping bags are shipped in, indicating an initial amount of 1,000 bags. The used bags have been flattened and replaced in the box for convenience. The bags are thin white plastic, identical visibly and materially to any other non-anomalous shopping bag. The printed slogan on each bag says **VALUE MAX!!!** in red letters, although the box was recovered from a Dollar General discount store. Efforts to locate additional bags are ongoing. 

The box has no anomalous properties. The bags are reusable but no more durable than any other plastic bag, and the anomalous effect stops as soon as the body of the bag is ripped. Ripping the handles does not affect the anomaly itself but does make it slightly more difficult to activate. 

Any item placed into the bag, then enclosed by compressing the top of the bag, either through twisting or squeezing, is immediately replaced with a significantly cheaper though semiotically similar item. If the replaced item is then enclosed again, the next replacement will be even more degraded in value, and items that are enclosed a third time are replaced with a crude and worthless approximation with no cash value whatsoever. 

The chain terminates there: the anomaly removes but does not replace items with no cash [[footnote]] Specifically American cash. [[/footnote]] value.

------


[[table  style="border-collapse:collapse; max-width: 600px;"]]
[[row]]
[[cell style="font-weight:bold;padding: .3em .7em; text-align: center; border: 1px solid black; background-color: silver; width: 20%;"]]
Test Log #1
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="font-weight:bold; padding: .3em .7em; text-align: center; border: 1px solid black; background-color: silver;"]]
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[cell style="text-align: center; padding: .3em .7em; border: 1px solid black"]]
Input
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: .3em .7em;"]]
Black office stapler.[[footnote]] Please note for the record that this was not the first item ever tested with SCP 8107, but simply the first item to be tested at Site-19 under proper documentation protocols. [[/footnote]]
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[cell style="text-align: center; padding: .3em .7em; border: 1px solid black"]]
Output
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: .3em .7em;"]]
Eight paperclips, tangled together.
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[cell style="text-align: center; padding: .3em .7em; border: 1px solid black"]]
Input
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: .3em .7em;"]]
Paperclips.
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[cell style="text-align: center; padding: .3em .7em; border: 1px solid black"]]
Output
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: .3em .7em;"]]
N/A
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[cell style="text-align: center; padding: .3em .7em; border: 1px solid black"]]
Special Note
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: .3em .7em;"]]
The bag ripped around the paperclips as it was closed. When opened, the bag contained nothing and no longer functioned in an anomalous manner.  
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[/table]]

[[row]]

One pound of very fine filet mignon, pan-seared medium-rare with herb butter by a French chef, lowered into bag on an antique china plate.
[[/cell]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="text-align: center; padding: .3em .7em; border: 1px solid black"]]
Output

[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: .3em .7em;"]]
Large [[footnote]] Please specify such measurements in the future. [[/footnote]] [[footnote]] It was bigger than a medium slice. [[/footnote]] [[footnote]] Agents that cannot take even "Safe" SCPs seriously when testing will find their access to such items curtailed in the future. [[/footnote]] [[footnote]] I don't know what to tell you other than it was a large slice of pizza. Go order a large slice of pizza and measure it. It was that big. [[/footnote]] slice of cheese pizza, room temperature, with three paper napkins
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[/table]]



[[table  style="border-collapse:collapse; max-width: 600px;"]]
[[row]]
[[cell style="font-weight:bold;padding: .3em .7em; text-align: center; border: 1px solid black; background-color: silver; width: 20%;"]]
Test Log # 40b

[[row]]

Input
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: .3em .7em;"]]
One pound raw filet mignon, same quality as before. [[footnote]] Again, this series of tests should have been numbered by input type, not sub-lettered. Dr ███████ is recommended for retraining as to proper testing procedures and documentation protocols. [[/footnote]]
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[cell style="text-align: center; padding: .3em .7em; border: 1px solid black"]]
Output
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: .3em .7em;"]]
One pound raw hamburger in package. Inspection shows it to be the same hamburger as the previous test.
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[cell style="text-align: center; padding: .3em .7em; border: 1px solid black"]]
Special note:
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: .3em .7em;"]]

This time the hamburger arrived frozen. Weird. [[footnote]] Dr ███████ is requested to refrain from including such subjective assertions in test logs. [[/footnote]]

[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[cell style="text-align: center; padding: .3em .7em; border: 1px solid black"]]
Input
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: .3em .7em;"]]
Raw hamburger.
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[cell style="text-align: center; padding: .3em .7em; border: 1px solid black"]]
Output
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: .3em .7em;"]]
Can of vienna sausages, dented.
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[cell style="text-align: center; padding: .3em .7em; border: 1px solid black"]]
Input
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: .3em .7em;"]]
Sausages.
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[cell style="text-align: center; padding: .3em .7em; border: 1px solid black"]]
Output
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: .3em .7em;"]]
Grease-spotted scrap of receipt paper, IOU handwritten with pen. Handwriting consistent.
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[/table]]

[[row]]

Bunch of bananas (six of them)[[footnote]] We're going with fruit, here. It's connected. I hate wrestling with all this ███████ table code anyway.[[/footnote]][[footnote]] The formatting for this test log is completely incorrect. Please revise. [[/footnote]] [[footnote]] You do it if it's that ███████ important. [[/footnote]]
[[/cell]]

[[row]]

Three fresh apples, Fuji.

Output

[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[row]]
[[cell style="text-align: center; padding: .3em .7em; border: 1px solid black"]]
Special Note:

Dr ███████ is married to Dr Kingston.[[footnote]] Was. [[/footnote]]

[[row]]
[[cell style="text-align: center; padding: .3em .7em; border: 1px solid black"]]
Special Note:
[[/cell]]
[[cell style="border: 1px solid black; padding: .3em .7em;"]]
Dr ███████ has a particular preference for artificial watermelon flavor, in case that's relevant to the proper testing procedures and documentation protocols that Dr Kingston loves so much.
[[/cell]]
[[/row]]
[[/table]]
